title: Harshal bought an article for Rs 380 and he spent Rs 20% of selling price on repairing. Although he got a profit of 20%, then what will be the selling price of that article? - Quora

response.answer_text: We can use a basic concept which formulated as: Selling Price i.e SP Cost Price i.e CP Selling Price = Cost Price + Profit; Profit = Selling Price - Cost Price; Now, calculating percentage as below Profit Percentage = { ( Selling Price - Cost Price )/ Cost Price } x 100; Or, SP = CP {1 + (Profit/100)}; ———— 1 Let SP is 100X And CP is the sum of the cost involved in the article before selling, here CP is the sum of purchasing cost and repairing cost; i.e 380 + 20% of SP; = 380 + {(20/100) x 100X} = 380 + 20X So, as per above formula —— 1 100X = (380 + 20X) {1 + (20/100)}; 100X = (380 + 20X ) (120/100); 5X = (19 + X) (6/5); 25X - 6X = 114; 19X = 114; X = 6 So, Selling Price is Rs. 600

As given , the purchase price of the article is 380/-and profit as 20% or 380*0.2 or 76/- …(1). Let the sell price be x/- and 20% of sale price as used for repairing is 0.2x/- The profit then is x-380-0.2x …(2) From equation (1) & (2) we get : x-380–0.2x = 76 or 0.8x= 76+380 =456 or x= 456/0.8 or 570. So, X or Sale price of the article is 570/-
Let Selling price of article = Rs X cost price of article = Rs 380 Add repair expensive =20/100 × X Actual CP = 380 + 20/100 X      76X=45600  ANSWER : selling price of article = Rs 600

lets assume the selling price to be 100y he spent 20%of it(sp) i.e. 20y on repairs total expendeture = cost price = 380 + 20y he got 20% profit i.e. sp is 120% of cp 100y = (380 + 20y) * 120/100 solving this you will get y = 6 therefore selling price = 6 * 100 = 600 rs hope this helps

Let's make it simple Let the selling price of the article 100% Cost price of the article is (380+20%) Selling price {(380+20%)*120}/100 {(380+20%)*6}/5 = (456+24%) By putting both the selling price equal 100% = 456+24% 76% = 456 Find SP or 100% = (456*100)/76 = 600

Let Selling Price be X Then X=380+1/6 of X(repairs)+1/5 of X (profit) (1/5 of out put becomes 1/6 of in put) X= 380+X/5+X/6 X=[11400(= 380*30)+6X+ 5X]/30 30X=11400+6X+5X 30X-6X-5X=11400 19X=11400 X=600 Selling Price is Rs 600/-. Cross Check 380+1/6 of 600(repairs) +1/5 of 600(profit)= 380+100+120=600.

Let the SP of the article be Rs x. Then according with the problem we have (120/100){380 + (20/100) x} = x => 120{380 + (20/100) x} = 100x => 6{380+(1/5)x} = 5x => 2280 + (6/5)x = 5x => 11400+6x = 25x => x = 600 Hence the SP of the article is Rs 600.
